title: BloggerCMS  - An Static Blog Creator CMS
body:
In the [last][1] post, I had mentioned about BloggerCMS which is used to build this very blog. BloggerCMS is dead simple CMS that can be used to create fully functional static blogs. Although there are [quite some static site generators][2] out there but I created BloggerCMS because I was missing these features in any of those static site generators:

 - Web interface that allows me to create blog posts, add pages and more instead of writing blog posts manually in bunch of different text files
 - Markdown editor with live preview feature so that I don't have to type Markdown syntax myself
 - I needed a true blog generator instead of generic/advanced site generator

Those three things are the driving force why I created BloggerCMS. Here is complete list of features of BloggerCMS as of now:

 - **Graphical User Interface** - manage your site via a browser
 - **File-based** - no database required
 - **Truly Static** - no server-side languages needed
 - **Portability** - copy, move, backup or version control your site easily
 - **Integrated Markdown Editor** - no need to know Markdown
 - **Built-in Images Manager**
 - **Disqus Commenting System**
 - **Search Posts Feature**
 - **Responsive Layout** - get started easily with the included responsive layout
 - **RSS Support**
 - **Sitemap Support**
 - **Code Highlight Support**
 - **Tags Cloud Support**
 - **Social Follow Section**
 - **Categories Section**
 - **Archives Section**

To know more about BloggerCMS, head over to [it's blog][3] or see [introductory post][4].


  [1]: https://codeinphp.github.io/post/welcome.html
  [2]: https://github.com/pinceladasdaweb/Static-Site-Generators#php
  [3]: https://codeinphp.github.io/bloggercms-demo
  [4]: https://codeinphp.github.io/bloggercms-demo/post/introducing-bloggercms.html

title: Welcome !
body:
**Hello, World !**

This is my first post on this blog hosted at awesome [github pages][1]. Previously I used to blog on wordpress [here][2] but I switched to github pages because I really wanted to have static blog with free hosting and ability to write up quick posts using [Markdown][3] syntax. In the [next post][4], I will write about **[BloggerCMS][5]**, a CMS I have made that helps create static blogs. This blog has also been generated via BloggerCMS :)

On this blog, I intend to write my ideas mainly about PHP as well as other related web development technologies. 

*Stay tuned :)*
